Based on the high content of linolenic acid in flaxseed oil, which is about 50 times higher than olive and sesame oils ( Table 1), addition of flaxseed oil to sesame and olive oil mixtures caused an effective decrease in ω 6:ω 3 ratio ( Table 2), which is very important from nutritional prospective. Therefore, blending flaxseed oil with other vegetable oils which are low in ω 3 fatty acid can change their fatty acid composition and increase ω 3 fatty acid content. Samples containing 10% and 15% flaxseed have optimal levels of ω 6:ω 3 ratio as stated in the literature for better health achievement ( Table 2).
